Web was looking for ways to combine High Wizard Int with Assassin Death Attack, so I've tried a ranged version

This Elven Assassin has 400 odd skill points and a base AB of 38, the standard good stuff (about 300 hp, 26 caster levels, Int 34, meta magic and crafting skills, UMD/Tumble etc, able to make deadly traps and set em etc etc)

5 attacks / round with Rapid Shot and Haste.

Death attack I'm calculating as I type:

10 + 3 + 12 to 18 = Fort save 25 to 31 (depending if Int is Capped)

Anyway, I bet a Rogue 5 / AA 11 / Wizard 24 split would be much more optimal in terms of AB (AB 26 for an extra attack / round), skill points and being able to set/retrieve epic traps etc

But I've never tried so I don't know if this death attack is good or not

Here's a roguish variant, for those of us who don't want to be evil (well you technically still could be evil, but you know what I mean..)

It has a base AB of 40 up to 6 attacks / round with Rapid Shot and Haste, about 450 skill points, evasion (reflex save 27 + 10 against spells = 37 hmmm dodge 95% of all fireballs hurled at you etc) and other rogue goodness (such as being able to retrieve and set epic traps hooray!)

I think it looks nicer to be honest but it just depends on whether the death attack is good or not with the other build. If the death attack is bad in the other build, then this build would be better for sure

Could increase int to 34 by dropping two of Craft Wand / Empower spell / Maximise Spell but dunno if it really makes the build more powerful dropping those goodies
